title: 114_hr108
content: There are no relevant paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. Section 8335a of Title 5, US Code, terminates retirement coverage for Members of Congress, effective at the start of the first Congress after enactment. Members will no longer be subject to this subchapter, and no further Government contributions or deductions will be made from their basic pay. The termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress under Section 8335a of Title 5, US Code, means no more Government contributions or deductions from their basic pay. Any rights, entitlements, or benefits prior to this change are not affected, and Members can still participate in the Thrift Savings Plan as per applicable laws. The termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress does not affect their eligibility to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan under applicable laws. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. The termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress does not impact their eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations may be set by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress does not affect their eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations may be set by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress does not impact eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations may be established by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code. The termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress does not affect eligibility for the Thrift Savings Plan. Regulations may be set by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management and the Executive Director. Amendments are made to chapter 83 of title 5, United States Code regarding contributions and deductions for Members. Members of Congress who are on or after the specified first day are exempt from this chapter, and no Government contributions or deductions from basic pay are allowed for deposit in the Treasury. Prior rights are not affected by this exemption. Members of Congress are exempt from certain provisions of this chapter, and their participation in the Thrift Savings Plan is not affected. Regulations for this section may be prescribed by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management. The regulations for matters relating to the Thrift Savings Plan are to be prescribed by the Executive Director. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections of chapter 84 of title 5, United States Code. Termination of retirement coverage for Members of Congress.
